pages.title: Welcome to Axiom Learning

objectives: Understand core concepts of modern web architecture

pages.title: Web Fundamentals
pages.question: Which of the following is NOT a core web technology?

feedback.correct: Correct! Python is a server-side language, not a core browser technology.
feedback.incorrect: Not quite. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the three core web technologies that run in browsers. Python is a server-side language.

pages.title: Web Components
pages.question: Which features are part of the Web Components standard? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Excellent! Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, and HTML Templates are the three pillars of Web Components.
feedback.incorrect: Web Components consist of Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, and HTML Templates. Virtual DOM is a React concept, not a web standard.

pages.title: Match the Terms
pages.question: Match each technology with its primary purpose:

feedback.correct: Perfect! You've correctly matched all the technologies.
feedback.incorrect: Review the connections between these technologies and their purposes.

pages.title: Complete the Code
pages.question: Fill in the blanks to complete this Web Component definition:

feedback.correct: Excellent! You understand the Web Component class structure.
feedback.incorrect: Review the Web Component lifecycle: extend HTMLElement, call super(), attach shadow with 'open' mode, and use customElements.define().

feedback.correct: Correct! SCORM = Shareable Content Object Reference Model.
feedback.incorrect: SCORM stands for Shareable Content Object Reference Model - a set of technical standards for e-learning software.

glossary.definition: A web standard that provides encapsulation for DOM and CSS, allowing components to have their own isolated DOM tree.
A set of JavaScript APIs that allow you to define custom HTML elements and their behavior.
Shareable Content Object Reference Model - a collection of standards for web-based e-learning content.
Learning Management System - software for administration, documentation, tracking, and delivery of educational courses.
A suite of technologies allowing you to create reusable custom elements with encapsulated functionality.
A web platform feature that allows control over what URLs get fetched by JavaScript import statements.
